content: perfect for layering over a tank in the warmer months this tee takes only one or two skeins of laceweight yarn it s knit from the top down with just two little seams under the arm for minimal finishing green machine is named after a piece of equipment at the madelinetosh headquarters in texas that skeins yarn that has come from the mill on cones the color in the sample was dyed specially for this project and is named jazz hands after jasmine herself **size** xs s m l 1x 2x 3x 4x 5x shown in size m with 6 75 inches/17 cm of positive ease **finished measurements** bust 29 5 34 5 38 75 43 75 48 75 53 75 58 5 63 5 68 5 inches / 75 87 5 100 5 112 5 125 138 150 162 5 175 5 cm length 18 5 19 19 5 20 20 5 21 21 5 22 22 5 inches / 47 48 5 49 5 51 52 53 5 54 5 56 57 cm **materials** yarn madelinetosh prairie 100% superwash merino 840 yds/768 m per 3 99 oz/113 g skein color jazz hands 1 1 1 2 2 2 2 2 2 skeins recommended needle size always use a needle size that gives you the gauge listed below - every knitter s gauge is unique us #3/3 25mm circular needles 24 inches/60 cm long notions stitch markers stitch holders yarn needle **gauge** 26 sts/36 row = 4 inches/10 cm in stockinette stitch note gauge is always taken after blocking note the first incarnation of this pattern lists two needle sizes - this was an oversight only one needle size is used througout
